author: Crazy_Chris
title: Upgrade your engines with lights
review:
Overview
Year of release: 1980
Last year in catalog: 1990
Set type: supplemental
Generation (within grey era): 1.0
Predecessor (within grey era): none
Successor (within grey era): none

Description
There were only three sets that were equipped with lights: 7740, 7745 and 7750. But Lego offered this little upgrade kit, which contains four light bricks, four cables and the special prism holder bricks. But the usage wasn't restricted to trains and wagons, the set can also be used to illuminate buildings.

Variants and alternate parts
Early versions of the light bricks have only 2 plug holes and smooth glass, while later versions have an additional center hole and diffuse glass.
Moreover, there are at least two different instruction booklets. One shows how to upgrade set 7725 (1981-1984) while the other one shows how to upgrade set 7735 (1985-1990). As set 7725 has been released in 1981, I am wondering if there is a third version that reflects year 1980.
From 1980 to 1988, the box was made of styrofoam with a cardbox sleeve. From 1989, the box was redesigned without styrofoam.

Personal opinion
Another proof of how Lego ran the system approach. You could start with a push-a-long train and upgrade everything. some sets are very well prepared for the lights kit, which means that the look doesn't change.
